clinical_study.brief_title: Short-term Effect of Glucose and Sacharose Ingestion on Cognitive Performance and Mood in Elderly
clinical_study.official_title: The Short-term Effect of Glucose and Sacharose Ingestion on Cognitive Performance and Mood in Elderly Subjects

brief_summary.textblock: The objective of the current study is to determine the acute effect of a glucose drink and a sacharose drink compared to a placebo on cognitive performance in elderly with light memory complaints. The investigators expect that the sugar containing drinks will improve memory and attentional functions. Furthermore, blood glucose response will be measured.

primary_outcome.measure: Performance on the paired associate recall test
primary_outcome.time_frame: cognitive tests will start 15 minutes after ingestion of the intervention product
primary_outcome.description: Cognitive performance will be assessed by several sensitive tests. Power is calculated on the paired associate recall test, but also several other cognitive performance test focusing on memory, attention and reaction time will be performed

secondary_outcome.time_frame: within 15 minutes after consuming the test drink and after completing the cognitive tests (within 90 minutes after consuming the test drink)
secondary_outcome.description: Mood will be measured by the POMS, after consuming the test drink, and after completing the congitive tests.

secondary_outcome.time_frame: from baseline till 90 minutes after consuming the drink
secondary_outcome.description: Blood glucose will be measured at five time points, at t=0, after 15 minutes, 30, 60 and 90 minutes.

secondary_outcome.time_frame: At t= -15 minutes, before consuming the test drink
secondary_outcome.description: One venapunction will be carried out at baseline to measure plasma insulin levels.

arm_group.description: The glucose drink contains 50 g of glucose soluted in 250 ml of water and lemon juice.
The sacharose drink contains 100 g of sacharose soluted in 250 ml of water and lemon juice.
The placebo contains a mixture of artificial sweeteners in order to have the same sweetness and appearance of the test drinks (the glucose drink and the sacharose drink).

intervention.description: The effect of a glucose solution on cognitive performance will be measured.
The effect of a sacharose solution on cognitive performance will be measured.
The effect of a placebo drink with sweeteners on cognitive performance will be measured.

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:
- Men and women
- 70 years and older
- Memory complaints
Exclusion Criteria:
- Type I or II diabetes
- Parkinson disease
- MMSE < 25 (to exclude cognitively impaired subjects
- CES-D > 16 (to exclude depressive subjects)
- Pharmacological antidepressives or medication for dementia
- Liver disease
